agenda.description: SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: State Affairs TIME & DATE: 9:00 AM, Thursday, April 25, 2019 PLACE: Senate Chamber CHAIR: Senator Joan Huffman To consider the following: HB 302 Paul | et al. SP: Hughes Relating to the carrying, storage, or possession of a firearm or firearm ammunition by certain persons on certain residential or commercial property. HB 347 King, Phil | et al. SP: Birdwell Relating to consent annexation requirements. HB 559 Thompson, Senfronia SP: Huffman Relating to written agreements incident to divorce or annulment. HB 598 Price | et al. SP: Zaffirini Relating to the use of funds appropriated for the continuing legal education of certain appointed masters, magistrates, referees, and associate judges. HB 1241 Bucy | et al. SP: Powell Relating to the content of a polling place location notice. HB 1689 Deshotel SP: Miles Relating to disclosure regarding the existence of a gestational agreement in a suit for the dissolution of a marriage and standing of an intended parent under a gestational agreement to file a suit affecting the parent-child relationship. HB 1872 Goldman | et al. SP: Hancock Relating to public access to certain information included on personal financial statements filed by county judicial officers. HB 2137 Burns | et al. SP: Flores Relating to an application made by certain retired state and federal officers to obtain a license to carry a handgun; waiving a fee. HB 2820 Flynn SP: Hughes Relating to the registration and certification of certain investment products made available to public school employees. SB 117 Creighton Relating to the prosecution of the offense of possessing a weapon in certain prohibited places associated with schools or postsecondary educational institutions. SB 535 Campbell Relating to the prosecution of and punishment for the offense of unlawfully carrying a handgun by a license holder. SB 1570 Flores Relating to the effect of certain felony convictions of certain corrections employees. SB 1783 Zaffirini Relating to guardianships, alternatives to guardianship, and supports and services for incapacitated persons. SB 1980 Hughes Relating to direct campaign expenditures by political committees. SB 2254 Miles Relating to the creation of magistrates in Fort Bend County Public testimony will be limited to 2 minutes. If submitting written testimony, please provide 20 copies to the committee clerk with your name on each.
